result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean B Silvan

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM Cases called: 21CF956 & 22CF285 Defendant Sean B Silvan appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Zebulon Patek for Sean B Silvan appeared in court, Attorney Robert W. Stoiber for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Victim/Witness statute complied with. There is an agreement. Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. Defendant makes statement to court.

Court orders:

18 months Probation sentence withheld with conditions

Conditions of Probation:
No contact with the University of Wisconsin Eau Claire Campus, its properties adjacent to it within one block radius
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
90 days jail with Huber all stayed pending further order of the court
court costs.

Anything else in 21CF956 is ordered dismissed and read, along with all of 22CF285 and uncharged DA case 21EC4233.

9 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 21CF956 & 22CF285)

Cases called at 11:44 AM: 21CF956, 22CF285.
Defendant Sean B Silvan appeared by video, in custody from the jail, Attorney Karl Schmidt appeared in court for Attorney Zebulon Patek, Attorney Robert W. Stoiber for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Attorney Schmidt indicates that he has not seen a copy of the Criminal Complaint in 22CF285 and requests an adjourned Initial Appearance. Court so orders.
21CF956: State requests $1,000 Cash Bond (history of failing to appear).Court orders $500 Cash bond to cover both cases. Warrant quashed.
STC/INIT: 3/11/22 at 2:30 PM.
Initial appearance on March 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
